📚 CLASE EN VIVO Evaluación NIVEL A2 - Choco Inglés
Notas Generales
Objetivo

Lograr que los estudiantes pasen con éxito todas las habilidades y demuestren que tienen los conocimientos necesarios que se requieren para ser certificados como un hablante de inglés en nivel A1

¿Hasta dónde se evalua en esta prueba?

Esta semana se estudia desde el módulo AQUÍ INICIAS EL NIVEL A2 hasta el módulo Semana 18: A2 TESTS PARA APROBAR EL NIVEL A2

Notas profesor

Este es el formato que el docente debe llenar https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1M6ymm7p4ZyLHwivDCiutwZ9XufRZbJIzYYVEzYUS3Yw/edit?gid=0#gid=0

Saludos

Los saludos deben ser reales. Un estudiante dice un saludo a otro compañero y este debe darle una respuesta.

Saludos Básicos

Palabra

Traducción

Frase Ejemplo

Traducción Frase Ejemplo

Hi

Hola

Hi! How are you?

¡Hola! ¿Cómo estás?

Hello

Hola

Hello, nice to meet you!

¡Hola, un placer conocerte!

Good morning

Buenos días

Good morning, everyone!

¡Buenos días a todos!

Good afternoon

Buenas tardes

Good afternoon, sir.

Buenas tardes, señor.

Good evening

Buenas noches

Good evening, how was your day?

Buenas noches, ¿cómo estuvo tu día?

Hey

Hola (informal)

Hey, what’s up?

¡Hola! ¿Qué pasa?

What’s up?

¿Qué tal?

What’s up, buddy?

¿Qué tal, amigo?

How are you?

¿Cómo estás?

How are you today?

¿Cómo estás hoy?

How’s it going?

¿Cómo va todo?

How’s it going at work?

¿Cómo va todo en el trabajo?

How do you do?

¿Cómo está usted?

How do you do, Mr. Smith?

¿Cómo está, Sr. Smith?
Saludos Intermedios

How have you been?

¿Cómo has estado?

How have you been lately?

¿Cómo has estado últimamente?

Long time no see

¡Cuánto tiempo!

Long time no see, my friend!

¡Cuánto tiempo, amigo!

Nice to see you

Gusto en verte

Nice to see you again!

¡Gusto en verte de nuevo!

It’s been a while

Ha pasado tiempo

It’s been a while since we met.

Ha pasado tiempo desde que nos vimos.

How’s everything?

¿Cómo va todo?

How’s everything at home?

¿Cómo va todo en casa?

How’s your day?

¿Cómo ha sido tu día?

How’s your day so far?

¿Cómo ha sido tu día hasta ahora?

What’s new?

¿Qué hay de nuevo?

What’s new with you?

¿Qué hay de nuevo contigo?

How’s life?

¿Cómo va la vida?

How’s life treating you?

¿Cómo te trata la vida?

How’s work?

¿Cómo va el trabajo?

How’s work these days?

¿Cómo va el trabajo estos días?

How’s your family?

¿Cómo está tu familia?

How’s your family doing?

¿Cómo está tu familia?
Saludos Avanzados

Greetings

Saludos

Greetings, colleagues!

¡Saludos, colegas!

Pleasure to meet you

Un placer conocerte

Pleasure to meet you in person!

¡Un placer conocerte en persona!

What have you been up to?

¿En qué has estado?

What have you been up to lately?

¿En qué has estado últimamente?

How’s your week going?

¿Cómo va tu semana?

How’s your week going so far?

¿Cómo va tu semana hasta ahora?

It’s a pleasure to see you again

Es un placer verte de nuevo

It’s a pleasure to see you again after so long.

Es un placer verte de nuevo después de tanto tiempo.
A2 Evaluación Vocabulario
Capacidad: ¿Qué va a hacer el profesor?
  1. Muestra una lectura al estudiante y esté debe traducir lo que dice ese texto. Obs: Si el estudiante no puede interpretar lo que está leyendo, debe decir el significado de las palabras. Las palabras en negrita dentro de los textos indican palabras claves que tuvieron un refuerzo especial en la plataforma
  2. También debe hacer la prueba del ANKI: Cada estudiante abre su ANKI y va diciendo el significado de cada una de las tarjetas. Debe hacer un mínimo de 10 tarjetas en 1 minutos
Evaluación: ¿Qué debe poder hacer el estudiante?

Ser capaz de reconocer el significado de la palabra

Lecturas para evaluar el vocabulario
Evaluación 1 Vocabulario Nivel A2

Reading Text (Students’ Version):

To begin something new can be hard, but it can also be exciting. I want to tell you about a man who decided to change his life.

He lived in the city and didn’t have much. It was clear that he needed something better for himself. They told him, “You can do it!” So he did.

Within a year, he was at a new job. It was not easy at first, but he worked hard. As time passed, he met new people and grew strong in his work.

He was not alone. There were many people on his team. They helped each other, and from that moment, everything changed. He did not stop, or give up.

He found which skills he had and focused on one goal: to change his life. All of this showed he will never give up.

There are many things we can say about him. He is a man who knew what he wanted. He worked hard to make it real.

When we believe, we can achieve. Even if it seems hard, we try. This man came out stronger than ever. He helped other people grow, so they can do the same.

What is the best way to start? Find your place, set a goal, and go forward.

The new year is here. Use some of your time to think and take action. Come and be part of these people who choose to change.

Know that others see your work. Always use what you get and help others. People like to see someone do well.

The first step is never easy. If you have any fear, face it. Work hard and believe.

Now, you may feel tired, but don’t stop. Life will give you good things. Always think of your goal.

Most people find it hard to start. But one day, you will smile.

He also helped others after finding success. That’s the way to grow.

You need to take steps. Take many, then more. You must stay strong.

Always look ahead, even before you feel ready. You can do great things.

Don’t go back — go forward. Push through problems. Even when the road feels long, you can walk it.

Think about where you want to go. If you have much to learn, take your time.

You should stay hopeful. Help people grow and feel proud.

If you fall down, stand up. Make your own plan. You can start just because you want it.

Do it because you know it is good for you and others.

We each have power. Help those who don’t feel strong.

Some things may seem difficult, but that’s okay.

Learn how to begin. Start with a high goal, not a low one.

Some steps are too big. Break them down and go one by one.

Choose a place where you feel good. Take a little time each day.

The world needs people like you. Your ideas are very important.

If things are hard, still try. Never stop. Keep going, no matter what.

You’re not the same person as yesterday. You grow every day.

Help another person, and you will begin something new again.

Do this while you can. You have a strong heart.

Your dreams are not just dreams. They are your number one goal.

Be proud of every part of your journey.

Evaluación 2 Vocabulario Nivel A2

Reading Text (Students’ Version): 2

In a small city, there was a programme made to help every child. The plan was to build a centre where children could study, play, and learn. A woman named Sara was the person who made this possible.

The centre was open to the public, and any member of the country could come. Sara wanted to provide a safe place for children to grow. She worked with a group of teachers who had great interest in education.

The course started early each morning and finished in the afternoon. Children could ask questions, play with light toys, and hear music. The system worked well, but there was one problem: they needed more water and food.

Sara decided to report the issue to the company that gave support. They promised to bring something the next week. During this time, the group had to keep the programme going without extra supplies.

During a meeting, Sara had to face a hard truth: the company might leave if they didn’t see results. She told the team, “We must continue, even if it is hard.” That night, she couldn’t sleep. She thought about how to increase support and make a better case for help.

The next day, Sara made a presentation to show their work. She used every fact, every name, and every story. “We must unite and stand together,” she said.

The company was moved and decided not to turn away. They sent a large truck with supplies. The children cheered when they saw the truck arrive.

From that day on, the programme became a model for social change. People from far places came to see how it worked. Even the government showed interest.

In the end, the centre helped not just one child but many. It was a real success.

Reading Text (Teacher’s Version): 2

Evaluación 3 Vocabulario Nivel A2

Reading Text (Students’ Version): 3

Today, a young boy and a girl went for a walk in the field. They were both students in the same school and wanted to read more about nature. The day was warm, the sky was clear, and there was nothing to worry about.

As they walked, they found a car near a tree. It looked old but in good condition. The boy said, “I hope we can understand who left it here.” The girl said, “Maybe it has a special story.” They opened the door and found a note inside.

The note said: “Return this car to the family. It has great value.” The boy looked at the girl and said, “This is important. We must act.”

They decided to inform a doctor who lived near. He said, “This type of car was common in the past. It may belong to a business or someone from the industry.”

The children didn’t understand all the words in the note, but they wanted to help. They asked the doctor to teach them more. “It will take a month,” he said, “but it’s the best way to learn.”

They worked every day. They learned about art, law, and the effect of old things on human life. The experience was hard but worth it.

They learned to speak in public, talk about facts, and carry out real action. The girl said, “I now believe in the power of small things.”

Though they were young, their minds were full of ideas. They wanted to continue to do good things. They made a plan to help others in the same way.

They met several people who gave them advice. Some told them to stop, but they did not. “We are strong enough,” the boy said. “Even if it costs us time.”

The next week, they found the car’s owner. He was old and kind. He said, “Thank you. You are the best kind of people.” He gave them a gift as a measure of thanks.

It was a simple thing, but it had great meaning. The girl said, “This was the most special thing we’ve ever done.”

They both went home, tired but happy. Their feet hurt from the long walk, but their hearts were light. They had found a reason to care

Evaluación 4 Vocabulario Nivel A2

Reading Text (Students’ Version): 4

Although he was young, John wanted to record stories about local history. He liked to sit in the town square. He wanted to determine if people would share stories. He felt his level of interest was high. He was sure he would receive support. Thus, in that moment, his spirit was free. He would train for college. He studied religion and music. He wanted to grow and learn. He believed education could serve society.

At his age, he read a book. He visited the board at the community centre to see recent announcements. He heard the sound of a car near the office. He could cut the noise. He took a step inside the class and met his teacher. She talked about position and how people stand above challenges. John felt strong. He saw a friend there. She said it was necessary to add new material in the course. They went to court for a field trip. They dealt with tax problems. They needed support from the party. They argued about whether to choose either history or art. They walked across the land to a museum.

In the next meeting, they organise d events. John tried to manage the group and answer questions. In half an hour, they took a break. They saw a fire drill. John did not lose money. He had to stop working to help.

The actual cost was already counted. They made a big effort to send supplies. They had to wait outside the department office. John was able to share his ideas. He gave a political speech to learn how to use his voice. He wanted clean air and together they shall cover all common subjects. They draw a short diagram. John remembered his wife had a dream to treat sick children. They had to limit the number of visitors on the road.

John wrote a letter using colour. He placed it behind the library door. The students produced a newsletter. They send it to every home. They learned a term about the total cost of the university. They saw the rise of interest in the century. They felt the success was possible. In a minute, John remembered his purpose.

Evaluación 5 Vocabulario Nivel A2

Reading Text (Students’ Version): 5

1. Two children test (1) a small farm (36) in the south (5).

2. A father (9) helps them. He sits at a table (10) to rest (11) and tells them to watch (3) the bear (12) near the field.

3. The boy and the girl rest for a moment and then enter (67) the barn.

4. Long ago (6), this land (49) was wild, but now the operation (39) is modern (26) and clean.

5. They learn about a new plant (18) and the amount (44) of water it needs each morning (43).

6. The market (14) will open soon, so they prepare (15) a picture (22) of the new plant.

7. It is hard (23) to draw a plant in dark (27) light, but they finish it on paper (72).

8. They decide (75) to visit (82) the station (99) in the west (21) to sell their idea.

9. Their mother will drive them there. She says it is important to observe (33) the future (34) of their small farm.

10. The farm (36) is under pressure (41) because the surface (28) of the field is poor.

11. They wish to improve the surface and raise (91) new crops.

12. The children share (76) a strong desire (77) to see peace (32) on their island (66).

13. They walk outside (46) at sunrise. The top (45) of the small hill is a nice view.

14. Sometimes (48), they feel fear (51) about a wild animal. They stop and look around.

15. Their friend from college says a creature may exist (96) in that area.

16. They are responsible (60) for the care of each plant and animal.

17. The secretary (62) of the union (64) sends a letter about a new rule (29) for all farmers.

18. The rule says they must accept (55) the new tax and charge (19) for each piece (47) of property (42).

19. The children wonder (53) if it is fair, but they must obey.

20. In the past, a member of the court judged similar cases.

28. That friend will visit (82) them soon (59).

Reading Text (Teacher’s Version): 5

  1. Two children test a small farm in the south.
  2. A father helps them. He sits at a table to rest and tells them to watch the bear near the field.
  3. The boy and the girl rest for a moment and then enter the barn.
  4. Long ago, this land was wild, but now the operation is modern and clean.
  5. They learn about a new plant and the amount of water it needs each morning.
  6. The market will open soon, so they prepare a picture of the new plant.
  7. It is hard to draw a plant in dark light, but they finish it on paper.
  8. They decide to visit the station in the west to sell their idea.
  9. Their mother will drive them there. She says it is important to observe the future of their small farm.
  10. The farm is under pressure because the surface of the field is poor.
  11. They wish to improve the surface and raise new crops.
  12. The children share a strong desire to see peace on their island.
  13. They walk outside at sunrise. The top of the small hill is a nice view.
  14. Sometimes, they feel fear about a wild animal. They stop and look around.
  15. Their friend from college says a creature may exist in that area.
  16. They are responsible for the care of each plant and animal.
  17. The secretary of the union sends a letter about a new rule for all farmers.
  18. The rule says they must accept the new tax and charge for each piece of property.
  19. The children wonder if it is fair, but they must obey.
  20. In the past, a member of the court judged similar cases.
  21. They will apply for support from a local officer.
  22. The woman in charge is effective and kindly explains the process.
  23. They learn how to draw and how to paint with colour.
  24. They know education is the key to a better life.
  25. They continue to grow, month by month.
  26. They have a wish to see various plants and books in their home.
  27. They write a story about this experiment and send it to a friend in the north.
  28. That friend will visit them soon.
  29. They hope their story will inspire other children to stand up for nature.
  30. The end of this story is clear: they are ready to face any test with heart and spirit.
A2 Evaluación Temas
Capacidad: ¿Qué va a hacer el profesor? 2

Hace las preguntas para evaluar los temas que debe conocer en ese nivel como familia, info personal; aunque reconocemos que no se ha abarcado completamente.

Evaluación: ¿Qué debe poder hacer el estudiante? 2

Ser capaz de responder las preguntas con una respuesta en nivel básico

Preguntas para evaluar los temas
4. Food and Drinks 🥦🍕🥤

  1. What’s your favorite food?

  2. Do you usually eat breakfast?

  3. What do you like to drink with lunch?

  4. Can you cook well?

  5. What food don’t you like?

  6. What do you eat for dinner?

  7. Do you prefer tea or coffee?

  8. How often do you eat vegetables?

  9. Is fast food good or bad for your health?

  10. What’s a typical meal in your country?

  11. Have you ever tried sushi?

  12. What fruits do you eat every week?

  13. Do you drink enough water every day?

  14. What do you usually eat on weekends?

  15. How do you make a sandwich?

  16. What food is common at parties in your culture?

  17. What do you usually order at a restaurant?

  18. Do you eat meat or are you vegetarian?

  19. How often do you eat out?

  20. What drink do you take when you're tired?

  21. What do you usually eat when you're sick?

  22. Is there a food you’ve never tried?

  23. What’s your favorite dessert?

  24. What do people usually eat for lunch in your country?

  25. Do you eat more when you're happy or sad?

5. Weather ☀️🌧️🌬️

  1. What’s the weather like today?

  2. Do you like rainy days?

  3. What season do you prefer?

  4. Is it hot or cold in your city in December?

  5. What do you wear when it’s cold?

  6. What do you do when it’s sunny?

  7. Does it snow where you live?

  8. How is the weather in spring where you live?

  9. What do you do on a stormy day?

  10. Can you describe a typical summer day in your country?

  11. Do you like windy days?

  12. What’s the hottest month of the year in your country?

  13. What weather do you hate the most?

  14. What kind of clothes do you wear in winter?

  15. What do people do when it rains a lot?

  16. How do you feel on cloudy days?

  17. Do you like watching the rain?

  18. What do you usually do during a thunderstorm?

  19. How’s the weather in your favorite city?

  20. Have you ever seen snow?

  21. What’s the weather like in the place where you want to travel?

  22. What’s your favorite kind of weather?

  23. Do you prefer dry or humid weather?

  24. Is the weather in your town changing?

  25. What’s the best season for traveling?

6. Hobbies and Free Time 🎨⚽🎮

  1. What do you do in your free time?

  2. Do you have any hobbies?

  3. What’s your favorite activity?

  4. Do you play any sports?

  5. How often do you go out with friends?

  6. Do you prefer watching movies or reading books?

  7. What kind of music do you listen to?

  8. Do you know how to play an instrument?

  9. What do you usually do on weekends?

  10. Have you ever tried painting?

  11. Do you go to the gym?

  12. What games do you like playing?

  13. Do you like dancing?

  14. What hobby would you like to try?

  15. Do you watch TV every day?

  16. How much free time do you have each week?

  17. What do you do when you’re bored?

  18. Do you prefer relaxing or doing something active?

  19. What’s a popular hobby in your country?

  20. Do you enjoy going to concerts?

  21. What do you do when you want to relax?

  22. Have you ever gone camping?

  23. What’s a fun activity you did recently?

  24. Do you follow any sports teams?

  25. What hobbies do your friends have?

7. Work and School 👩‍🏫🏢📚

  1. What do you do? (work/study)

  2. Where do you work or study?

  3. Do you like your job or school?

  4. What time do you start work/classes?

  5. What subjects do you like?

  6. Do you have a favorite teacher or boss?

  7. What do you do during breaks?

  8. How do you go to work/school?

  9. Do you wear a uniform?

  10. What’s your daily routine at school/work?

  11. What don’t you like about your job or school?

  12. What do you need for your classes?

  13. Do you get along with your classmates or coworkers?

  14. Do you use a computer at work or school?

  15. What do you want to study in the future?

  16. Do you have homework or tasks every day?

  17. What was your favorite subject in school?

  18. Have you ever been late?

  19. What do you usually eat during lunch at work/school?

  20. Do you work or study from home sometimes?

  21. What do you do after school/work?

  22. What skills are important for your job?

  23. Do you work full-time or part-time?

  24. What would you like to do in the future?

  25. Do you like working in a team?

8. Shopping and Money 🛍️💸💳

  1. Do you like shopping?

  2. Where do you usually buy clothes?

  3. Do you prefer shopping online or in stores?

  4. How much do you spend on food each week?

  5. Do you use cash or a card?

  6. What’s the last thing you bought?

  7. Do you ever buy second-hand things?

  8. How often do you go shopping?

  9. Do you compare prices before buying?

  10. What do you usually buy at the supermarket?

  11. Have you ever returned something?

  12. Do you like shopping alone or with someone?

  13. How do you save money?

  14. What do you spend the most money on?

  15. What’s something expensive you want to buy?

  16. Do you buy gifts for your friends or family?

  17. Is it easy to find good prices in your country?

  18. Do you think you spend too much?

  19. What’s your favorite store?

  20. Do you follow a budget?

  21. How do you feel when you spend a lot of money?

  22. Do you prefer local or international brands?

  23. Have you ever bought something you didn’t need?

  24. Do you know how to use discounts or coupons?

  25. What would you do if you had a lot of money?

Frase en inglés

Tom was sad.

Su madre y su padre siempre estaban ocupados.

¡Vamos afuera juntos!

The weather is nice.

El clima está agradable.

Tom replied.

Prefiero quedarme adentro.

No hay nada divertido allá afuera.

Hay algo divertido en todas partes si miras.

Tom pensó por un momento.

It's better than doing nothing.

Es mejor que no hacer nada.

Me alegra que lo hayamos hecho.

That's great!

¡Eso es genial!

Whether you play inside or out.

Ya sea que juegues adentro o afuera.

Siempre es bueno hacer cosas juntos.

Desde ese día, Tom supo que sin su familia, la vida no sería tan divertida.

He learned that there was always something to enjoy.

Aprendió que siempre había algo para disfrutar.

No matter what.

No importa qué.

With both hands, María stepped into the bath.

Con ambas manos, María entró en la bañera.

She was ready to begin her daily ritual.

Estaba lista para comenzar su ritual diario.

The path she walked each morning led her to reflect on the Earth and its wonders.

El camino que recorría cada mañana la llevaba a reflexionar sobre la Tierra y sus maravillas.

This month marked a year since the birth of her daughter.

Este mes marcó un año desde el nacimiento de su hija.

It was a joyous occasion.

Fue una ocasión feliz.

It had forever changed her perspective on life and death.

Había cambiado para siempre su perspectiva sobre la vida y la muerte.

La fe siempre había sido importante para María.

Now it took on new meaning.

Ahora tenía un nuevo significado.

Ella fue testigo del crecimiento de su hija.

The worth of every moment became clearer.

El valor de cada momento se volvió más claro.

Atesoraba la salud de su familia por encima de todo.

As she dried off, María pondered the truth of her existence.

Mientras se secaba, María reflexionó sobre la verdad de su existencia.

She realized that wealth wasn't just about money.

Se dio cuenta de que la riqueza no se trataba solo de dinero.

It was about the richness of experiences and relationships.

Se trataba de la riqueza de las experiencias y las relaciones.

With this understanding came a newfound strength.

Con esta comprensión llegó una nueva fuerza.

It would guide her through whatever challenges lay ahead.

La guiaría a través de cualquier desafío que estuviera por venir.

A2 Evaluación Comprensión
Capacidad: ¿Qué va a hacer el profesor? 4

Va a evaluar las estructuras que debe manejar en ese nivel como tiempos y verbos.

Evaluación: ¿Qué debe poder hacer el estudiante? 4

Debe poder comprender cualquiera de las siguientes lecturas

Lecturas a Evaluar
Lectura 1 Comprensión Nivel A2

1. My Family
I come from a big family. I have three brothers and two sisters. We like to spend time together, especially on weekends. My parents are very kind and always help us. Every Sunday, we have lunch together at my grandparents' house.

2. My House
My house is not very big, but it is comfortable. It has two bedrooms, a living room, a kitchen, and a small garden. I like spending time in the garden because I love flowers. My room is my favorite place. I study, read, and sometimes watch TV there.

3. My Best Friend
My best friend is Sara. She is very smart and funny. We have been friends for five years. We go to the same school and sit together in class. We love talking about books, movies, and our favorite hobbies.

Lectura 2 Comprensión Nivel A2

4. My Favorite Food
My favorite food is pasta. I like it with tomato sauce and cheese. I also enjoy trying different types of pizza. I don’t eat much fast food, but I love hamburgers and fries sometimes. For dessert, I prefer fruit or ice cream.

5. A Day at School
I usually wake up early because my school starts at 7:30 a.m. My favorite subject is history because I enjoy learning about the past. After classes, I often go to the library to study. I also like playing soccer with my classmates during breaks.

6. My Hobbies
One of my favorite hobbies is painting. I started painting when I was 10 years old. I also enjoy cycling in the park and listening to music. On weekends, I sometimes play video games or watch movies with my friends.

7. The Weather
Today, it’s cloudy, and it might rain later. I don’t like rainy days because I can’t go outside. My favorite weather is sunny but not too hot. In the spring, the flowers bloom, and everything looks beautiful.

Lectura 3 Comprensión Nivel A2

In a small town in Chocó, Colombia, the López family is famous for having one of the most unusual stories in the country. Alberto López and his wife Rosa have 23 children, and their goal is to reach 30. But it’s not just about love or tradition; they want to build a real team to work in their successful business: López Manufacturing, a factory that makes clothes and detergents for the whole country.

From the moment the children are 9 months old, they already have a job in the factory. No child is excluded from working, no matter how small. As the story about this family grows, the local TV station Choco Red News gets interested in the case and decides to report what’s happening inside the factory.

Lectura 4 Comprensión Nivel A2

Angélica, a dedicated lawyer and loving mom, devoted her life to her family. She had always envisioned a beautiful future with her children: graduations, birthdays, weddings, and the sweet sound of grandchildren running through her house.

With courage, Angélica called her three children, saying, "Take me to eat wherever I want. I want to enjoy my last days." She smiled, even though it was forced.

On the weekend, when they arrived at the restaurant, Angélica ordered a feast: meat, chicken, seafood, and all the juices she craved. "Mom, you can’t eat that; it’s too much," Lucas interrupted, concern in his eyes.

Lectura 5 Comprensión Nivel A2

“Christopher, you are responsible for your brothers and sister today,” she said firmly. “Serve them lunch, and don’t let anyone leave the house.”

“Yes, mom, I will,” Christopher replied, though deep down, he loved the idea of being free for the day.

“Help me! I can’t swim anymore!” But his friends laughed. “He’s joking,” one of them said. “He always plays pranks like this.”

But this time, he wasn’t playing. As he struggled to keep his head above water, he realized they weren’t coming back for him. Christopher’s heart sank. How could they leave me here?

A2 Evaluación Speaking
Capacidad: ¿Qué va a hacer el profesor? 5

Hace las preguntas para evaluar su capacidad de comunicarse y hablar en inglés

Evaluación: ¿Qué debe poder hacer el estudiante? 5

Ser capaz de responder las preguntas con una respuesta en nivel básico

Preguntas para evaluar el speaking
🧍‍♀️ Información personal

  1. What’s your name?

  2. How old are you?

  3. Where are you from?

  4. Where do you live?

  5. What do you do?

  6. What languages do you speak?

  7. Are you married or single?

  8. Do you have any brothers or sisters?

  9. What’s your phone number?

  10. What’s your email address?

🕒 Rutina diaria

  1. What time do you usually wake up?

  2. What do you do in the morning?

  3. What time do you go to work/school?

  4. What do you usually eat for breakfast?

  5. What do you do after work/school?

  6. What time do you go to bed?

  7. Do you take a shower in the morning or at night?

  8. How do you usually get to work/school?

  9. What do you do on weekends?

  10. Do you have lunch at home or outside?

🍕 Comida y bebida

  1. What’s your favorite food?

  2. Can you cook?

  3. What do you usually eat for dinner?

  4. Do you prefer tea or coffee?

  5. Do you usually eat at home or in a restaurant?

  6. What food don’t you like?

  7. Do you eat meat?

  8. What’s your favorite restaurant?

  9. What do you usually drink with lunch?

  10. Can you name 5 fruits in English?

🎉 Tiempo libre y hobbies

  1. What do you like to do in your free time?

  2. Do you play any sports?

  3. What kind of music do you like?

  4. Do you watch TV or Netflix?

  5. What’s your favorite movie?

  6. Do you play video games?

  7. Do you like reading?

  8. What do you do on the weekend?

  9. What’s your favorite hobby?

  10. Do you go out with friends?

✈️ Viajes y vacaciones

  1. Do you like traveling?

  2. Where did you go on your last vacation?

  3. How do you usually travel (bus, car, plane)?

  4. Where would you like to go on vacation?

  5. Do you prefer the beach or the mountains?

🏠 Casa y entorno

  1. Do you live in a house or an apartment?

  2. Is your home big or small?

  3. Do you have a garden?

  4. Where do you spend most of your time?

  5. Do you live near a park or a supermarket?

A2 Evaluación Herramientas
Capacidad: ¿Qué va a hacer el profesor? 6
  • Asegurarse de que todos los estudiantes tienen las actividades de este nivel realizadas para poder ser aprobados en esta evaluación.
  • El profesor hace una evaluación del ANKI de cada estudiante tal y como se hace en las clases en vivo regulares; la diferencia radica en que el profesor evalúa (sin previo aviso) diferentes contenidos al mismo estudiante en la misma clase
Actividades a realizar
  1. Audios Diarios: 60 publicaciones subidas
  2. Actividades de la plataforma: 9 publicaciones subidas
  3. Tests: 13 tests aprobados subidas
Evaluación: ¿Qué debe poder hacer el estudiante? 6
  • Plataforma y herramientas: Conocer todo el contenido del ANKI.
  • Herramienta de reducción de ruido: Que pueda entender cualquier audio de reducción de ruido
Reducción de Ruido a Evaluar (Las mismas del nivel)

Traducción al español

Sí, veo al gato.

Yes, he likes the movie.

Sí, a él le gusta la película.

Does he play football?

¿Él juega fútbol?

No, he doesn't play football.

No, él no juega fútbol.

¿Tiene ella un lápiz?

Yes, she has a pencil.

Sí, ella tiene un lápiz.

Does she like apples?

¿A ella le gustan las manzanas?

Yes, she likes apples.

Sí, a ella le gustan las manzanas.

Is that his bag?

¿Es esa su mochila? (de él)

No, that is not his bag.

No, esa no es su mochila.

Is this a dog?

¿Es esto un perro?

No, it's a cat.

No, es un gato.

Is this a pen?

¿Es esto un bolígrafo?

Yes, it's a pen.

Sí, es un bolígrafo.

Is this her book?

¿Es este su libro? (de ella)

Yes, it is her book.

Sí, es su libro. (de ella)

Reductor Th Sounds después de la lección Sonido Th - Fundamentación Indispensable

Frase en inglés

Traducción al español

Fernando, Michael and Pedro were friends.

Fernando, Michael y Pedro eran amigos.

It was a sunny Thursday.

Era un jueves soleado.

They decided to go to the park.

Ellos decidieron ir al parque.

There were many fun things to do.

Había muchas cosas divertidas para hacer.

These children were playing and laughing.

Estos niños estaban jugando y riendo.

They were having a great time.

Ellos la estaban pasando muy bien.

The three friends walked through the park.

Los tres amigos caminaron por el parque.

They thought about what to do next.

Pensaron en qué hacer después.

Hey, I think it’s getting really hot.

Oye, creo que se está poniendo muy caliente.

Let’s get some ice cream.

Vamos por un helado.

That’s a great idea!

¡Esa es una gran idea!

The others said.

Los otros dijeron.

They looked at those colorful ice cream flavors.

Miraron esos sabores coloridos de helado.

They couldn’t decide which one to choose.

No pudieron decidir cuál elegir.

Then, one of them said.

Entonces, uno de ellos dijo.

Let’s get them all!

¡Vamos a cogerlos todos!

They bought a few flavors.

Compraron algunos sabores.

They thanked the vendor.

Agradecieron al vendedor.

Though it was hot, they were happy.

Aunque hacía calor, estaban felices.

They knew that days like this were worth a thousand memories.

Sabían que días como este valían mil recuerdos.

Tom was sad.

Tom estaba triste.

His mother and father were always busy.

Su madre y su padre siempre estaban ocupados.

The other day, his brother Jack said.

El otro día, su hermano Jack dijo.

Let's go outside together!

¡Vamos afuera juntos!

The weather is nice.

El clima está agradable.

Tom replied.

Tom respondió.

I'd rather stay inside.

Prefiero quedarme adentro.

There's nothing fun out there.

No hay nada divertido allá afuera.

Jack smiled.

Jack sonrió.

Brother, that's not true!

¡Hermano, eso no es cierto!

There's something fun everywhere if you look.

Hay algo divertido en todas partes si miras.

Come on, I'll show you.

Vamos, te lo mostraré.

Tom thought for a moment.

Tom pensó por un momento.

Well... okay.

Bueno... está bien.

It's better than doing nothing.

Es mejor que no hacer nada.

When they got home, their parents were there.

Cuando llegaron a casa, sus padres estaban allí.

Did you do anything fun today?

¿Hiciste algo divertido hoy?

Asked their mother.

Preguntó su madre.

We did everything!

¡Hicimos de todo!

Tom said happily.

Dijo Tom felizmente.

We played in the park.

Jugamos en el parque.

Although I didn't want to go at first.

Aunque no quería ir al principio.

I'm glad we did.

Me alegra que lo hayamos hecho.

Their father smiled.

Su padre sonrió.

That's great!

¡Eso es genial!

Whether you play inside or out.

Ya sea que juegues adentro o afuera.

It's always good to do things together.

Siempre es bueno hacer cosas juntos.

From that day on, Tom knew that without his family, life wouldn't be as fun.

Desde ese día, Tom supo que sin su familia, la vida no sería tan divertida.

He learned that there was always something to enjoy.

Aprendió que siempre había algo para disfrutar.

No matter what.

No importa qué.

With both hands, María stepped into the bath.

Con ambas manos, María entró en la bañera.

She was ready to begin her daily ritual.

Estaba lista para comenzar su ritual diario.

The path she walked each morning led her to reflect on the Earth and its wonders.

El camino que recorría cada mañana la llevaba a reflexionar sobre la Tierra y sus maravillas.

This month marked a year since the birth of her daughter.

Este mes marcó un año desde el nacimiento de su hija.

It was a joyous occasion.

Fue una ocasión feliz.

It had forever changed her perspective on life and death.

Había cambiado para siempre su perspectiva sobre la vida y la muerte.

Faith had always been important to María.

La fe siempre había sido importante para María.

Now it took on new meaning.

Ahora tenía un nuevo significado.

She witnessed the growth of her child.

Ella fue testigo del crecimiento de su hija.

The worth of every moment became clearer.

El valor de cada momento se volvió más claro.

She treasured her family's health above all else.

Atesoraba la salud de su familia por encima de todo.

As she dried off, María pondered the truth of her existence.

Mientras se secaba, María reflexionó sobre la verdad de su existencia.

She realized that wealth wasn't just about money.

Se dio cuenta de que la riqueza no se trataba solo de dinero.

It was about the richness of experiences and relationships.

Se trataba de la riqueza de las experiencias y las relaciones.

With this understanding came a newfound strength.

Con esta comprensión llegó una nueva fuerza.

It would guide her through whatever challenges lay ahead.

La guiaría a través de cualquier desafío que estuviera por venir.

Frase en inglés

Yes, their mother is a great cook.

Sí, su mamá es una excelente cocinera.

The chicken is raw.

El pollo está crudo.

¿Qué está haciendo nuestra mamá ahora?

She is boiling some potatoes.

Ella está hirviendo unas papas.

I like to fry eggs.

Sí, las verduras están frescas.

¿Puedo tomar algo de agua, por favor?

Articles – with countable and uncountable nouns

Esta película es peor que la primera

Worse

Worse

My dad is older than my mom

Mi papá es mayor que mi mamá

Comparative 2 syllabs words: older

This chair is higher than that table

Esta silla es más alta que esa mesa

Comparative 2 syllabs words: higher

Today is colder than yesterday

Hoy está más frío que ayer

Comparative 2 syllabs words: colder

This exercise is more difficult than the last one

Este ejercicio es más difícil que el último

Comparative 3 or more syllabs words: more difficult

The city is more expensive than the village

La ciudad es más cara que el pueblo

Comparative 3 or more syllabs words: more expensive

This computer is more modern than mine

Esta computadora es más moderna que la mía

Comparative 3 or more syllabs words: more modern

Despedidas

Las despedidas deben ser reales. Un estudiante se despide de un compañero y este debe darle una respuesta, despidiéndose también.

Despedidas Básicos

Palabra

Traducción

Frase Ejemplo

Traducción Frase Ejemplo

Bye

Adiós

Bye! See you soon!

¡Adiós! ¡Nos vemos pronto!

Goodbye

Adiós (formal)

Goodbye, take care!

Adiós, ¡cuídate!

See you later

Nos vemos luego

See you later, alligator!

¡Nos vemos luego, cocodrilo!

See you soon

Nos vemos pronto

See you soon, my friend!

¡Nos vemos pronto, amigo!

Take care

Cuídate

Take care and stay safe!

¡Cuídate y mantente a salvo!

See you tomorrow

Nos vemos mañana

See you tomorrow at school!

¡Nos vemos mañana en la escuela!

See you next time

Nos vemos la próxima

See you next time, John!

¡Nos vemos la próxima, John!

Have a good day

Que tengas un buen día

Have a good day at work!

¡Que tengas un buen día en el trabajo!

Have a nice day

Que tengas un lindo día

Have a nice day, everyone!

¡Que tengan un lindo día, todos!

Have a great day

Que tengas un gran día

Have a great day ahead!

¡Que tengas un gran día por delante!
Despedidas Intermedios

Take it easy

Tómalo con calma

Take it easy, don’t stress!

Tómalo con calma, ¡no te estreses!

Catch you later

Te veo luego

Catch you later, man!

¡Te veo luego, amigo!

I gotta go

Me tengo que ir

I gotta go, talk to you later!

Me tengo que ir, ¡hablamos luego!

Talk to you later

Hablamos luego

Talk to you later, okay?

Hablamos luego, ¿ok?

Until next time

Hasta la próxima

Until next time, buddy!

¡Hasta la próxima, amigo!

Have a good one

Que te vaya bien

Have a good one, take care!

¡Que te vaya bien, cuídate!

Peace out

Me largo (informal)

Peace out, guys!

¡Me largo, chicos!

Later

Nos vemos (informal)

Later, dude!

¡Nos vemos, amigo!

Until we meet again

Hasta que nos veamos de nuevo

Until we meet again, my friend!

Hasta que nos veamos de nuevo, amigo!

Stay safe

Mantente a salvo

Stay safe on your trip!

¡Mantente a salvo en tu viaje!
Despedidas Avanzados

Farewell

Despedida formal

Farewell, my dear friend.

Adiós, mi querido amigo.

It was nice seeing you

Fue un gusto verte

It was nice seeing you again.

Fue un gusto verte de nuevo.

Take care of yourself

Cuídate bien

Take care of yourself, okay?

Cuídate bien, ¿vale?

Keep in touch

Mantente en contacto

Keep in touch, don’t forget me!

¡Mantente en contacto, no me olvides!

Wishing you all the best

Te deseo lo mejor

Wishing you all the best in your new job!

¡Te deseo lo mejor en tu nuevo trabajo!

Las despedidas deben ser reales. Un estudiante se despide de un compañero y este debe darle una respuesta, despidiéndose también.

Notas Generales
Objetivo

Lograr que los estudiantes pasen con éxito todas las habilidades y demuestren que tienen los conocimientos necesarios que se requieren para ser certificados como un hablante de inglés en nivel A1

¿Hasta dónde se evalua en esta prueba?

Esta semana se estudia desde el módulo AQUÍ INICIAS EL NIVEL A2 hasta el módulo Semana 18: A2 TESTS PARA APROBAR EL NIVEL A2

Notas profesor

Este es el formato que el docente debe llenar https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1M6ymm7p4ZyLHwivDCiutwZ9XufRZbJIzYYVEzYUS3Yw/edit?gid=0#gid=0

Saludos

Los saludos deben ser reales. Un estudiante dice un saludo a otro compañero y este debe darle una respuesta.

Saludos Básicos

Palabra

Traducción

Frase Ejemplo

Traducción Frase Ejemplo

Hi

Hola

Hi! How are you?

¡Hola! ¿Cómo estás?

Hello

Hola

Hello, nice to meet you!

¡Hola, un placer conocerte!

Good morning

Buenos días

Good morning, everyone!

¡Buenos días a todos!

Good afternoon

Buenas tardes

Good afternoon, sir.

Buenas tardes, señor.

Good evening

Buenas noches

Good evening, how was your day?

Buenas noches, ¿cómo estuvo tu día?

Hey

Hola (informal)

Hey, what’s up?

¡Hola! ¿Qué pasa?

What’s up?

¿Qué tal?

What’s up, buddy?

¿Qué tal, amigo?

How are you?

¿Cómo estás?

How are you today?

¿Cómo estás hoy?

How’s it going?

¿Cómo va todo?

How’s it going at work?

¿Cómo va todo en el trabajo?

How do you do?

¿Cómo está usted?

How do you do, Mr. Smith?

¿Cómo está, Sr. Smith?
Saludos Intermedios

¿Cómo has estado últimamente?

¡Cuánto tiempo, amigo!

Gusto en verte

Nice to see you again!

¡Gusto en verte de nuevo!

Ha pasado tiempo desde que nos vimos.

A2 Evaluación Vocabulario
Capacidad: ¿Qué va a hacer el profesor?
  1. Muestra una lectura al estudiante y esté debe traducir lo que dice ese texto. Obs: Si el estudiante no puede interpretar lo que está leyendo, debe decir el significado de las palabras. Las palabras en negrita dentro de los textos indican palabras claves que tuvieron un refuerzo especial en la plataforma
  2. También debe hacer la prueba del ANKI: Cada estudiante abre su ANKI y va diciendo el significado de cada una de las tarjetas. Debe hacer un mínimo de 10 tarjetas en 1 minutos
Evaluación: ¿Qué debe poder hacer el estudiante?

Ser capaz de reconocer el significado de la palabra

Lecturas para evaluar el vocabulario
Evaluación 1 Vocabulario Nivel A2

Reading Text (Students’ Version):

To begin something new can be hard, but it can also be exciting. I want to tell you about a man who decided to change his life.

He lived in the city and didn’t have much. It was clear that he needed something better for himself. They told him, “You can do it!” So he did.

Within a year, he was at a new job. It was not easy at first, but he worked hard. As time passed, he met new people and grew strong in his work.

He was not alone. There were many people on his team. They helped each other, and from that moment, everything changed. He did not stop, or give up.

He found which skills he had and focused on one goal: to change his life. All of this showed he will never give up.

There are many things we can say about him. He is a man who knew what he wanted. He worked hard to make it real.

When we believe, we can achieve. Even if it seems hard, we try. This man came out stronger than ever. He helped other people grow, so they can do the same.

What is the best way to start? Find your place, set a goal, and go forward.

The new year is here. Use some of your time to think and take action. Come and be part of these people who choose to change.

Know that others see your work. Always use what you get and help others. People like to see someone do well.

The first step is never easy. If you have any fear, face it. Work hard and believe.

Now, you may feel tired, but don’t stop. Life will give you good things. Always think of your goal.

Most people find it hard to start. But one day, you will smile.

He also helped others after finding success. That’s the way to grow.

You need to take steps. Take many, then more. You must stay strong.

Always look ahead, even before you feel ready. You can do great things.

Don’t go back — go forward. Push through problems. Even when the road feels long, you can walk it.

Think about where you want to go. If you have much to learn, take your time.

You should stay hopeful. Help people grow and feel proud.

If you fall down, stand up. Make your own plan. You can start just because you want it.

Do it because you know it is good for you and others.

We each have power. Help those who don’t feel strong.

Some things may seem difficult, but that’s okay.

Learn how to begin. Start with a high goal, not a low one.

Some steps are too big. Break them down and go one by one.

Choose a place where you feel good. Take a little time each day.

The world needs people like you. Your ideas are very important.

If things are hard, still try. Never stop. Keep going, no matter what.

You’re not the same person as yesterday. You grow every day.

Help another person, and you will begin something new again.

Do this while you can. You have a strong heart.

Your dreams are not just dreams. They are your number one goal.

Be proud of every part of your journey.

Reading Text (Teacher’s Version):

Evaluación 2 Vocabulario Nivel A2

Reading Text (Students’ Version): 2

In a small city, there was a programme made to help every child. The plan was to build a centre where children could study, play, and learn. A woman named Sara was the person who made this possible.

The centre was open to the public, and any member of the country could come. Sara wanted to provide a safe place for children to grow. She worked with a group of teachers who had great interest in education.

The course started early each morning and finished in the afternoon. Children could ask questions, play with light toys, and hear music. The system worked well, but there was one problem: they needed more water and food.

Sara decided to report the issue to the company that gave support. They promised to bring something the next week. During this time, the group had to keep the programme going without extra supplies.

During a meeting, Sara had to face a hard truth: the company might leave if they didn’t see results. She told the team, “We must continue, even if it is hard.” That night, she couldn’t sleep. She thought about how to increase support and make a better case for help.

The next day, Sara made a presentation to show their work. She used every fact, every name, and every story. “We must unite and stand together,” she said.

The company was moved and decided not to turn away. They sent a large truck with supplies. The children cheered when they saw the truck arrive.

From that day on, the programme became a model for social change. People from far places came to see how it worked. Even the government showed interest.

In the end, the centre helped not just one child but many. It was a real success.

Evaluación 3 Vocabulario Nivel A2

Reading Text (Students’ Version): 3

Today, a young boy and a girl went for a walk in the field. They were both students in the same school and wanted to read more about nature. The day was warm, the sky was clear, and there was nothing to worry about.

As they walked, they found a car near a tree. It looked old but in good condition. The boy said, “I hope we can understand who left it here.” The girl said, “Maybe it has a special story.” They opened the door and found a note inside.

The note said: “Return this car to the family. It has great value.” The boy looked at the girl and said, “This is important. We must act.”

They decided to inform a doctor who lived near. He said, “This type of car was common in the past. It may belong to a business or someone from the industry.”

The children didn’t understand all the words in the note, but they wanted to help. They asked the doctor to teach them more. “It will take a month,” he said, “but it’s the best way to learn.”

They worked every day. They learned about art, law, and the effect of old things on human life. The experience was hard but worth it.

They learned to speak in public, talk about facts, and carry out real action. The girl said, “I now believe in the power of small things.”

Though they were young, their minds were full of ideas. They wanted to continue to do good things. They made a plan to help others in the same way.

They met several people who gave them advice. Some told them to stop, but they did not. “We are strong enough,” the boy said. “Even if it costs us time.”

The next week, they found the car’s owner. He was old and kind. He said, “Thank you. You are the best kind of people.” He gave them a gift as a measure of thanks.

It was a simple thing, but it had great meaning. The girl said, “This was the most special thing we’ve ever done.”

They both went home, tired but happy. Their feet hurt from the long walk, but their hearts were light. They had found a reason to care

Evaluación 4 Vocabulario Nivel A2

Reading Text (Students’ Version): 4

Although he was young, John wanted to record stories about local history. He liked to sit in the town square. He wanted to determine if people would share stories. He felt his level of interest was high. He was sure he would receive support. Thus, in that moment, his spirit was free. He would train for college. He studied religion and music. He wanted to grow and learn. He believed education could serve society.

At his age, he read a book. He visited the board at the community centre to see recent announcements. He heard the sound of a car near the office. He could cut the noise. He took a step inside the class and met his teacher. She talked about position and how people stand above challenges. John felt strong. He saw a friend there. She said it was necessary to add new material in the course. They went to court for a field trip. They dealt with tax problems. They needed support from the party. They argued about whether to choose either history or art. They walked across the land to a museum.

In the next meeting, they organise d events. John tried to manage the group and answer questions. In half an hour, they took a break. They saw a fire drill. John did not lose money. He had to stop working to help.

The actual cost was already counted. They made a big effort to send supplies. They had to wait outside the department office. John was able to share his ideas. He gave a political speech to learn how to use his voice. He wanted clean air and together they shall cover all common subjects. They draw a short diagram. John remembered his wife had a dream to treat sick children. They had to limit the number of visitors on the road.

John wrote a letter using colour. He placed it behind the library door. The students produced a newsletter. They send it to every home. They learned a term about the total cost of the university. They saw the rise of interest in the century. They felt the success was possible. In a minute, John remembered his purpose.

Lecturas para evaluar el vocabulario
Evaluación 1 Vocabulario Nivel A2

Reading Text (Students’ Version):

To begin something new can be hard, but it can also be exciting. I want to tell you about a man who decided to change his life.

He lived in the city and didn’t have much. It was clear that he needed something better for himself. They told him, “You can do it!” So he did.

Within a year, he was at a new job. It was not easy at first, but he worked hard. As time passed, he met new people and grew strong in his work.

He was not alone. There were many people on his team. They helped each other, and from that moment, everything changed. He did not stop, or give up.

He found which skills he had and focused on one goal: to change his life. All of this showed he will never give up.

There are many things we can say about him. He is a man who knew what he wanted. He worked hard to make it real.

When we believe, we can achieve. Even if it seems hard, we try. This man came out stronger than ever. He helped other people grow, so they can do the same.

What is the best way to start? Find your place, set a goal, and go forward.

The new year is here. Use some of your time to think and take action. Come and be part of these people who choose to change.

Know that others see your work. Always use what you get and help others. People like to see someone do well.

The first step is never easy. If you have any fear, face it. Work hard and believe.

Now, you may feel tired, but don’t stop. Life will give you good things. Always think of your goal.

Most people find it hard to start. But one day, you will smile.

He also helped others after finding success. That’s the way to grow.

You need to take steps. Take many, then more. You must stay strong.

Always look ahead, even before you feel ready. You can do great things.

Don’t go back — go forward. Push through problems. Even when the road feels long, you can walk it.

Think about where you want to go. If you have much to learn, take your time.

You should stay hopeful. Help people grow and feel proud.

If you fall down, stand up. Make your own plan. You can start just because you want it.

Do it because you know it is good for you and others.

We each have power. Help those who don’t feel strong.

Some things may seem difficult, but that’s okay.

Learn how to begin. Start with a high goal, not a low one.

Some steps are too big. Break them down and go one by one.

Choose a place where you feel good. Take a little time each day.

The world needs people like you. Your ideas are very important.

If things are hard, still try. Never stop. Keep going, no matter what.

You’re not the same person as yesterday. You grow every day.

Help another person, and you will begin something new again.

Do this while you can. You have a strong heart.

Your dreams are not just dreams. They are your number one goal.

Be proud of every part of your journey.

In a small city, there was a programme made to help every child. The plan was to build a centre where children could study, play, and learn. A woman named Sara was the person who made this possible.

The centre was open to the public, and any member of the country could come. Sara wanted to provide a safe place for children to grow. She worked with a group of teachers who had great interest in education.

The company was moved and decided not to turn away. They sent a large truck with supplies. The children cheered when they saw the truck arrive.

From that day on, the programme became a model for social change. People from far places came to see how it worked. Even the government showed interest.

In the end, the centre helped not just one child but many. It was a real success.

Reading Text (Teacher’s Version): 2

In a small (1) city (2), there was a programme (3) made to help (4) every child (5). The plan (6) was to build (7) a centre (8) where children could study (9), play (10), and learn (11). A woman (12) named Sara was the person (13) who made this possible (14).

The centre (15) was open (16) to the public (17), and any member (18) of the country (19) could come (20). Sara wanted to provide (21) a safe place (22) for children to grow. She worked with a group (23) of teachers who had great (24) interest (25) in education.

The course (26) started early (27) each morning and finished in the afternoon (28). Children could ask (29) questions (30), play with light (31) toys, and hear (32) music. The system (33) worked well, but there was one problem (34): they needed more (35) water (36) and food.

Sara decided to report (37) the issue to the company (38) that gave support. They promised to bring (39) something (40) the next week (41). During this time (42), the group (43) had to keep (44) the programme (45) going without (46) extra supplies.

During (47) a meeting, Sara had to face (48) a hard truth: the company (49) might leave (50) if they didn’t see results (51). She told the team, “We must continue (52), even if it is hard.” That night (53), she couldn’t sleep. She thought about how to increase (54) support and make a better case (55) for help.

The next day, Sara made a presentation (56) to show (57) their work (58). She used every fact (59), every name (60), and every story. “We must unite (61) and stand (62) together (63),” she said.

The company (64) was moved and decided not to turn (65) away (66). They sent a large (67) truck with supplies. The children cheered when they saw the truck (68) arrive (69).

From that day on (70), the programme (71) became a model (72) for social (73) change. People (74) from far (75) places came to see (76) how it worked. Even the government (77) showed interest (78).

In the end (79), the centre (80) helped not just one child (81) but many. It was a real (82) success.

Evaluación 3 Vocabulario Nivel A2

Reading Text (Students’ Version): 3

Today, a young boy and a girl went for a walk in the field. They were both students in the same school and wanted to read more about nature. The day was warm, the sky was clear, and there was nothing to worry about.

As they walked, they found a car near a tree. It looked old but in good condition. The boy said, “I hope we can understand who left it here.” The girl said, “Maybe it has a special story.” They opened the door and found a note inside.

The note said: “Return this car to the family. It has great value.” The boy looked at the girl and said, “This is important. We must act.”

They decided to inform a doctor who lived near. He said, “This type of car was common in the past. It may belong to a business or someone from the industry.”

The children didn’t understand all the words in the note, but they wanted to help. They asked the doctor to teach them more. “It will take a month,” he said, “but it’s the best way to learn.”

They worked every day. They learned about art, law, and the effect of old things on human life. The experience was hard but worth it.

They learned to speak in public, talk about facts, and carry out real action. The girl said, “I now believe in the power of small things.”

Though they were young, their minds were full of ideas. They wanted to continue to do good things. They made a plan to help others in the same way.

They met several people who gave them advice. Some told them to stop, but they did not. “We are strong enough,” the boy said. “Even if it costs us time.”

The next week, they found the car’s owner. He was old and kind. He said, “Thank you. You are the best kind of people.” He gave them a gift as a measure of thanks.

It was a simple thing, but it had great meaning. The girl said, “This was the most special thing we’ve ever done.”

They both went home, tired but happy. Their feet hurt from the long walk, but their hearts were light. They had found a reason to care

Reading Text (Teacher’s Version): 3

Evaluación 4 Vocabulario Nivel A2

Reading Text (Students’ Version): 4

Although he was young, John wanted to record stories about local history. He liked to sit in the town square. He wanted to determine if people would share stories. He felt his level of interest was high. He was sure he would receive support. Thus, in that moment, his spirit was free. He would train for college. He studied religion and music. He wanted to grow and learn. He believed education could serve society.

At his age, he read a book. He visited the board at the community centre to see recent announcements. He heard the sound of a car near the office. He could cut the noise. He took a step inside the class and met his teacher. She talked about position and how people stand above challenges. John felt strong. He saw a friend there. She said it was necessary to add new material in the course. They went to court for a field trip. They dealt with tax problems. They needed support from the party. They argued about whether to choose either history or art. They walked across the land to a museum.

In the next meeting, they organise d events. John tried to manage the group and answer questions. In half an hour, they took a break. They saw a fire drill. John did not lose money. He had to stop working to help.

The actual cost was already counted. They made a big effort to send supplies. They had to wait outside the department office. John was able to share his ideas. He gave a political speech to learn how to use his voice. He wanted clean air and together they shall cover all common subjects. They draw a short diagram. John remembered his wife had a dream to treat sick children. They had to limit the number of visitors on the road.

John wrote a letter using colour. He placed it behind the library door. The students produced a newsletter. They send it to every home. They learned a term about the total cost of the university. They saw the rise of interest in the century. They felt the success was possible. In a minute, John remembered his purpose.

8. They decide (75) to visit (82) the station (99) in the west (21) to sell their idea.

11. They wish to improve the surface and raise (91) new crops.

12. The children share (76) a strong desire (77) to see peace (32) on their island (66).

  1. Two children test a small farm in the south.
  2. A father helps them. He sits at a table to rest and tells them to watch the bear near the field.

  11. They wish to improve the surface and raise new crops.
  12. The children share a strong desire to see peace on their island.
  13. They walk outside at sunrise. The top of the small hill is a nice view.
  14. Sometimes, they feel fear about a wild animal. They stop and look around.
  15. Their friend from college says a creature may exist in that area.
  16. They are responsible for the care of each plant and animal.

  18. The rule says they must accept the new tax and charge for each piece of property.

A2 Evaluación Temas
Capacidad: ¿Qué va a hacer el profesor? 2

Hace las preguntas para evaluar los temas que debe conocer en ese nivel como familia, info personal; aunque reconocemos que no se ha abarcado completamente.

Evaluación: ¿Qué debe poder hacer el estudiante? 2

Ser capaz de responder las preguntas con una respuesta en nivel básico

Preguntas para evaluar los temas
4. Food and Drinks 🥦🍕🥤

  1. What’s your favorite food?

  2. Do you usually eat breakfast?

  3. What do you like to drink with lunch?

  4. Can you cook well?

  5. What food don’t you like?

  6. What do you eat for dinner?

  7. Do you prefer tea or coffee?

  8. How often do you eat vegetables?

  9. Is fast food good or bad for your health?

  10. What’s a typical meal in your country?

  11. Have you ever tried sushi?

  12. What fruits do you eat every week?

  13. Do you drink enough water every day?

  14. What do you usually eat on weekends?

  15. How do you make a sandwich?

  16. What food is common at parties in your culture?

  17. What do you usually order at a restaurant?

  18. Do you eat meat or are you vegetarian?

  19. How often do you eat out?

  20. What drink do you take when you're tired?

  21. What do you usually eat when you're sick?

  22. Is there a food you’ve never tried?

  23. What’s your favorite dessert?

  24. What do people usually eat for lunch in your country?

  25. Do you eat more when you're happy or sad?

5. Weather ☀️🌧️🌬️

  1. What’s the weather like today?

  2. Do you like rainy days?

  3. What season do you prefer?

  4. Is it hot or cold in your city in December?

  5. What do you wear when it’s cold?

  6. What do you do when it’s sunny?

  7. Does it snow where you live?

  8. How is the weather in spring where you live?

  9. What do you do on a stormy day?

  10. Can you describe a typical summer day in your country?

  11. Do you like windy days?

  12. What’s the hottest month of the year in your country?

  13. What weather do you hate the most?

  14. What kind of clothes do you wear in winter?

  15. What do people do when it rains a lot?

  16. How do you feel on cloudy days?

  17. Do you like watching the rain?

  18. What do you usually do during a thunderstorm?

  19. How’s the weather in your favorite city?

  20. Have you ever seen snow?

  21. What’s the weather like in the place where you want to travel?

  22. What’s your favorite kind of weather?

  23. Do you prefer dry or humid weather?

  24. Is the weather in your town changing?

  25. What’s the best season for traveling?

6. Hobbies and Free Time 🎨⚽🎮

  1. What do you do in your free time?

  2. Do you have any hobbies?

  3. What’s your favorite activity?

  4. Do you play any sports?

  5. How often do you go out with friends?

  6. Do you prefer watching movies or reading books?

  7. What kind of music do you listen to?

  8. Do you know how to play an instrument?

  9. What do you usually do on weekends?

  10. Have you ever tried painting?

  11. Do you go to the gym?

  12. What games do you like playing?

  13. Do you like dancing?

  14. What hobby would you like to try?

  15. Do you watch TV every day?

  16. How much free time do you have each week?

  17. What do you do when you’re bored?

  18. Do you prefer relaxing or doing something active?

  19. What’s a popular hobby in your country?

  20. Do you enjoy going to concerts?

  21. What do you do when you want to relax?

  22. Have you ever gone camping?

  23. What’s a fun activity you did recently?

  24. Do you follow any sports teams?

  25. What hobbies do your friends have?

7. Work and School 👩‍🏫🏢📚

  1. What do you do? (work/study)

  2. Where do you work or study?

  3. Do you like your job or school?

  4. What time do you start work/classes?

  5. What subjects do you like?

  6. Do you have a favorite teacher or boss?

  7. What do you do during breaks?

  8. How do you go to work/school?

  9. Do you wear a uniform?

  10. What’s your daily routine at school/work?

  11. What don’t you like about your job or school?

  12. What do you need for your classes?

  13. Do you get along with your classmates or coworkers?

  14. Do you use a computer at work or school?

  15. What do you want to study in the future?

  16. Do you have homework or tasks every day?

  17. What was your favorite subject in school?

  18. Have you ever been late?

  19. What do you usually eat during lunch at work/school?

  20. Do you work or study from home sometimes?

  21. What do you do after school/work?

  22. What skills are important for your job?

  23. Do you work full-time or part-time?

  24. What would you like to do in the future?

  25. Do you like working in a team?

8. Shopping and Money 🛍️💸💳

  1. Do you like shopping?

  2. Where do you usually buy clothes?

  3. Do you prefer shopping online or in stores?

  4. How much do you spend on food each week?

  5. Do you use cash or a card?

  6. What’s the last thing you bought?

  7. Do you ever buy second-hand things?

  8. How often do you go shopping?

  9. Do you compare prices before buying?

  10. What do you usually buy at the supermarket?

  11. Have you ever returned something?

  12. Do you like shopping alone or with someone?

  13. How do you save money?

  14. What do you spend the most money on?

  15. What’s something expensive you want to buy?

  16. Do you buy gifts for your friends or family?

  17. Is it easy to find good prices in your country?

  18. Do you think you spend too much?

  19. What’s your favorite store?

  20. Do you follow a budget?

  21. How do you feel when you spend a lot of money?

  22. Do you prefer local or international brands?

  23. Have you ever bought something you didn’t need?

  24. Do you know how to use discounts or coupons?

  25. What would you do if you had a lot of money?

  21. How do you feel when you spend a lot of money?

  22. Do you prefer local or international brands?

  23. Have you ever bought something you didn’t need?

  24. Do you know how to use discounts or coupons?

  25. What would you do if you had a lot of money?

A2 Evaluación Listening
Capacidad: ¿Qué va a hacer el profesor? 3
  1. Opción 1: El profesor coloca un audio de reductores de ruido y el estudiante dice qué dijo el audio y lo traduce al español. (El estudiante dice: She’s tall - Ella es alta)
  2. Opción 2: El docente lee los reductores y el estudiante dice qué dijo el audio y lo traduce al español. (El estudiante dice: She’s tall - Ella es alta)
Evaluación: ¿Qué debe poder hacer el estudiante? 3

Debe poder entender los siguientes audios.

Tom was sad.

El clima está agradable.

Es mejor que no hacer nada.

That's great!

¡Eso es genial!

Ya sea que juegues adentro o afuera.

Siempre es bueno hacer cosas juntos.

Desde ese día, Tom supo que sin su familia, la vida no sería tan divertida.

He learned that there was always something to enjoy.

Aprendió que siempre había algo para disfrutar.

No matter what.

No importa qué.

With both hands, María stepped into the bath.

Con ambas manos, María entró en la bañera.

She was ready to begin her daily ritual.

Estaba lista para comenzar su ritual diario.

Este mes marcó un año desde el nacimiento de su hija.

It was a joyous occasion.

Fue una ocasión feliz.

It had forever changed her perspective on life and death.

Había cambiado para siempre su perspectiva sobre la vida y la muerte.

La fe siempre había sido importante para María.

Now it took on new meaning.

Ahora tenía un nuevo significado.

Ella fue testigo del crecimiento de su hija.

The worth of every moment became clearer.

El valor de cada momento se volvió más claro.

Atesoraba la salud de su familia por encima de todo.

Mientras se secaba, María reflexionó sobre la verdad de su existencia.

Se trataba de la riqueza de las experiencias y las relaciones.

With this understanding came a newfound strength.

Con esta comprensión llegó una nueva fuerza.

It would guide her through whatever challenges lay ahead.

La guiaría a través de cualquier desafío que estuviera por venir.

Esta silla es más alta que esa mesa

Esta computadora es más moderna que la mía

Spanish translation

Topic

We are going to watch a movie this weekend

Vamos a ver una película este fin de semana

They are going to buy a new car

Ellos van a comprar un carro nuevo

going to

He is going to study for the test

Él va a estudiar para el examen

going to

Él está leyendo un libro ahora mismo

present continuous

The children are playing in the park

Los niños están jugando en el parque

A2 Evaluación Comprensión
Capacidad: ¿Qué va a hacer el profesor? 4

Va a evaluar las estructuras que debe manejar en ese nivel como tiempos y verbos.

Evaluación: ¿Qué debe poder hacer el estudiante? 4

Debe poder comprender cualquiera de las siguientes lecturas

Lecturas a Evaluar
Lectura 1 Comprensión Nivel A2

1. My Family
I come from a big family. I have three brothers and two sisters. We like to spend time together, especially on weekends. My parents are very kind and always help us. Every Sunday, we have lunch together at my grandparents' house.

2. My House
My house is not very big, but it is comfortable. It has two bedrooms, a living room, a kitchen, and a small garden. I like spending time in the garden because I love flowers. My room is my favorite place. I study, read, and sometimes watch TV there.

3. My Best Friend
My best friend is Sara. She is very smart and funny. We have been friends for five years. We go to the same school and sit together in class. We love talking about books, movies, and our favorite hobbies.

Lectura 2 Comprensión Nivel A2

4. My Favorite Food
My favorite food is pasta. I like it with tomato sauce and cheese. I also enjoy trying different types of pizza. I don’t eat much fast food, but I love hamburgers and fries sometimes. For dessert, I prefer fruit or ice cream.

5. A Day at School
I usually wake up early because my school starts at 7:30 a.m. My favorite subject is history because I enjoy learning about the past. After classes, I often go to the library to study. I also like playing soccer with my classmates during breaks.

6. My Hobbies
One of my favorite hobbies is painting. I started painting when I was 10 years old. I also enjoy cycling in the park and listening to music. On weekends, I sometimes play video games or watch movies with my friends.

7. The Weather
Today, it’s cloudy, and it might rain later. I don’t like rainy days because I can’t go outside. My favorite weather is sunny but not too hot. In the spring, the flowers bloom, and everything looks beautiful.

Lectura 3 Comprensión Nivel A2

In a small town in Chocó, Colombia, the López family is famous for having one of the most unusual stories in the country. Alberto López and his wife Rosa have 23 children, and their goal is to reach 30. But it’s not just about love or tradition; they want to build a real team to work in their successful business: López Manufacturing, a factory that makes clothes and detergents for the whole country.

From the moment the children are 9 months old, they already have a job in the factory. No child is excluded from working, no matter how small. As the story about this family grows, the local TV station Choco Red News gets interested in the case and decides to report what’s happening inside the factory.

Lectura 4 Comprensión Nivel A2

Angélica, a dedicated lawyer and loving mom, devoted her life to her family. She had always envisioned a beautiful future with her children: graduations, birthdays, weddings, and the sweet sound of grandchildren running through her house.

With courage, Angélica called her three children, saying, "Take me to eat wherever I want. I want to enjoy my last days." She smiled, even though it was forced.

On the weekend, when they arrived at the restaurant, Angélica ordered a feast: meat, chicken, seafood, and all the juices she craved. "Mom, you can’t eat that; it’s too much," Lucas interrupted, concern in his eyes.

Lectura 5 Comprensión Nivel A2

“Christopher, you are responsible for your brothers and sister today,” she said firmly. “Serve them lunch, and don’t let anyone leave the house.”

“Yes, mom, I will,” Christopher replied, though deep down, he loved the idea of being free for the day.

“Help me! I can’t swim anymore!” But his friends laughed. “He’s joking,” one of them said. “He always plays pranks like this.”

But this time, he wasn’t playing. As he struggled to keep his head above water, he realized they weren’t coming back for him. Christopher’s heart sank. How could they leave me here?

A2 Evaluación Speaking
Capacidad: ¿Qué va a hacer el profesor? 5

Hace las preguntas para evaluar su capacidad de comunicarse y hablar en inglés

Evaluación: ¿Qué debe poder hacer el estudiante? 5

Ser capaz de responder las preguntas con una respuesta en nivel básico

Preguntas para evaluar el speaking
🧍‍♀️ Información personal

  1. What’s your name?

  2. How old are you?

  3. Where are you from?

  4. Where do you live?

  5. What do you do?

  6. What languages do you speak?

  7. Are you married or single?

  8. Do you have any brothers or sisters?

  9. What’s your phone number?

  10. What’s your email address?

🕒 Rutina diaria

  1. What time do you usually wake up?

  2. What do you do in the morning?

  3. What time do you go to work/school?

  4. What do you usually eat for breakfast?

  5. What do you do after work/school?

  6. What time do you go to bed?

  7. Do you take a shower in the morning or at night?

  8. How do you usually get to work/school?

  9. What do you do on weekends?

  10. Do you have lunch at home or outside?

🍕 Comida y bebida

  1. What’s your favorite food?

  2. Can you cook?

  3. What do you usually eat for dinner?

  4. Do you prefer tea or coffee?

  5. Do you usually eat at home or in a restaurant?

  6. What food don’t you like?

  7. Do you eat meat?

  8. What’s your favorite restaurant?

  9. What do you usually drink with lunch?

  10. Can you name 5 fruits in English?

🎉 Tiempo libre y hobbies

  1. What do you like to do in your free time?

  2. Do you play any sports?

  3. What kind of music do you like?

  4. Do you watch TV or Netflix?

  5. What’s your favorite movie?

  6. Do you play video games?

  7. Do you like reading?

  8. What do you do on the weekend?

  9. What’s your favorite hobby?

  10. Do you go out with friends?

✈️ Viajes y vacaciones

  1. Do you like traveling?

  2. Where did you go on your last vacation?

  3. How do you usually travel (bus, car, plane)?

  4. Where would you like to go on vacation?

  5. Do you prefer the beach or the mountains?

🏠 Casa y entorno

  1. Do you live in a house or an apartment?

  2. Is your home big or small?

  3. Do you have a garden?

  4. Where do you spend most of your time?

  5. Do you live near a park or a supermarket?

A2 Evaluación Herramientas
Capacidad: ¿Qué va a hacer el profesor? 6
  • Asegurarse de que todos los estudiantes tienen las actividades de este nivel realizadas para poder ser aprobados en esta evaluación.
  • El profesor hace una evaluación del ANKI de cada estudiante tal y como se hace en las clases en vivo regulares; la diferencia radica en que el profesor evalúa (sin previo aviso) diferentes contenidos al mismo estudiante en la misma clase
Actividades a realizar
  1. Audios Diarios: 60 publicaciones subidas
  2. Actividades de la plataforma: 9 publicaciones subidas
  3. Tests: 13 tests aprobados subidas
Evaluación: ¿Qué debe poder hacer el estudiante? 6
  • Plataforma y herramientas: Conocer todo el contenido del ANKI.
  • Herramienta de reducción de ruido: Que pueda entender cualquier audio de reducción de ruido
Reducción de Ruido a Evaluar (Las mismas del nivel)

Reductor Acciones, Artículos, His y Her después de la lección Acciones, Artículos, His y Her (H1- A)

Pregunta en inglés

Traducción al español

Do you see the cat?

¿Ves al gato?

Yes, I see the cat.

Sí, veo al gato.

Does he like the movie?

¿A él le gusta la película?

Yes, he likes the movie.

Sí, a él le gusta la película.

Does he play football?

¿Él juega fútbol?

No, he doesn't play football.

Comparative 2 syllabs words: older

Esta silla es más alta que esa mesa

Comparative 2 syllabs words: higher

Hoy está más frío que ayer

Comparative 2 syllabs words: colder

Este ejercicio es más difícil que el último

Comparative 3 or more syllabs words: more difficult

La ciudad es más cara que el pueblo

Comparative 3 or more syllabs words: more expensive

Esta computadora es más moderna que la mía

Capacidad: ¿Qué va a hacer el profesor? 6
  • Asegurarse de que todos los estudiantes tienen las actividades de este nivel realizadas para poder ser aprobados en esta evaluación.
  • El profesor hace una evaluación del ANKI de cada estudiante tal y como se hace en las clases en vivo regulares; la diferencia radica en que el profesor evalúa (sin previo aviso) diferentes contenidos al mismo estudiante en la misma clase
Actividades a realizar
  1. Audios Diarios: 60 publicaciones subidas
  2. Actividades de la plataforma: 9 publicaciones subidas
  3. Tests: 13 tests aprobados subidas
Despedidas

Las despedidas deben ser reales. Un estudiante se despide de un compañero y este debe darle una respuesta, despidiéndose también.

Despedidas Básicos

Palabra

Traducción

Frase Ejemplo

Traducción Frase Ejemplo

Bye

Adiós

Bye! See you soon!

¡Adiós! ¡Nos vemos pronto!

Goodbye

Adiós (formal)

Goodbye, take care!

Adiós, ¡cuídate!

See you later

Nos vemos luego

See you later, alligator!

¡Nos vemos luego, cocodrilo!

See you soon

Nos vemos pronto

See you soon, my friend!

¡Nos vemos pronto, amigo!

Take care

Cuídate

Take care and stay safe!

¡Cuídate y mantente a salvo!

See you tomorrow

Nos vemos mañana

See you tomorrow at school!

¡Nos vemos mañana en la escuela!

See you next time

Nos vemos la próxima

See you next time, John!

¡Nos vemos la próxima, John!

Have a good day

Que tengas un buen día

Have a good day at work!

¡Que tengas un buen día en el trabajo!

Have a nice day

Que tengas un lindo día

Have a nice day, everyone!

¡Que tengan un lindo día, todos!

Have a great day

Que tengas un gran día

Have a great day ahead!

¡Que tengas un gran día por delante!
Despedidas Intermedios

Take it easy

Tómalo con calma

Take it easy, don’t stress!

Tómalo con calma, ¡no te estreses!

Catch you later

Te veo luego

Catch you later, man!

¡Te veo luego, amigo!

I gotta go

Me tengo que ir

I gotta go, talk to you later!

Me tengo que ir, ¡hablamos luego!

Talk to you later

Hablamos luego

Talk to you later, okay?

Hablamos luego, ¿ok?

Until next time

Hasta la próxima

Until next time, buddy!

¡Hasta la próxima, amigo!

Have a good one

Que te vaya bien

Have a good one, take care!

¡Que te vaya bien, cuídate!

Peace out

Me largo (informal)

Peace out, guys!

¡Me largo, chicos!

Later

Nos vemos (informal)

Later, dude!

¡Nos vemos, amigo!

Until we meet again

Hasta que nos veamos de nuevo

Until we meet again, my friend!

Hasta que nos veamos de nuevo, amigo!

Stay safe

Mantente a salvo

Stay safe on your trip!

¡Mantente a salvo en tu viaje!
Despedidas Avanzados

Farewell

Despedida formal

Farewell, my dear friend.

Adiós, mi querido amigo.

It was nice seeing you

Fue un gusto verte

It was nice seeing you again.

Fue un gusto verte de nuevo.

Take care of yourself

Cuídate bien

Take care of yourself, okay?

Cuídate bien, ¿vale?

Keep in touch

Mantente en contacto

Keep in touch, don’t forget me!

¡Mantente en contacto, no me olvides!

Wishing you all the best

Te deseo lo mejor

Wishing you all the best in your new job!

¡Te deseo lo mejor en tu nuevo trabajo!
